title: 'Abusive ex banned me from taking the Pill and made me go shopping as I gave birth'
text:

Laura Wallis suffered horrific emotional and physical abuse at the hands of her controlling ex-partner for five years before she had the courage to walk away.

The young mum was banned from taking the contraceptive Pill and even forced to go to the supermarket to get the family's shopping while she was in labour and her ex was at home sorting his golf clubs.

When she finally got to hospital, Laura was already in advanced labour, but Jamie screamed at her for "taking too long to give birth".

For years Laura's family and friends had warned her about her relationship with Jamie McKinlay but she says she felt powerless to end it.

Even when he was jailed for assaulting her, Laura still took McKinlay back.

(Image: FOCUS FEATURES)

His demands included sex at least once a day, often twice, or he would accuse her of cheating on him.

The mum of five from Lancashire said: “For years, I was under Jamie’s spell. He attacked me several times and was convicted three times for assault, but I always went back.

“He told me what to wear and how to behave. If we didn’t have sex every day, he would accuse me of cheating on him.

“After our first daughter was born, I went on the contraceptive pill but Jamie went mad. He said he wanted more kids and so I had to come off it.

“When I went into labour, I asked him to take me to hospital, but he said we had no food and he made me do an Iceland shop first.

(Image: FOCUS FEATURES)

“When I look back, I can’t believe the way he controlled me and made me so miserable. My message to other women is walk away – and stay away.”

Laura was just 17 when she met McKinlay, who was seven years older than her, and quickly fell under his spell.

She said: "I bumped into him a few times in the corner shop. He was very attractive, he worked out a lot.

"He was much older and so I looked up to him – I did as he said.”

Their relationship moved quickly and just two weeks after they met McKinlay had Laura's name tattooed on her chest.

(Image: FOCUS FEATURES)

He then asked her to move in with him.

Laura said: "I was very young, and I felt flattered. He was very intense. He would insist on sitting next to me all the time on the couch, I wasn’t even allowed to sit on my own.

“He didn’t like me going anywhere without him. I couldn’t send a text without him checking it first.

“We had to have sex daily – sometimes twice a day – or he’d accuse me of cheating. It was draining, physically and emotionally.”

In July 2010, McKinlay was jailed for six months for assaulting Laura but she took him back after her pleaded for forgiveness.

(Image: FOCUS FEATURES)

In May 2011, their first daughter was born, and struggling to cope, Laura went on the pill.

She said: "I didn’t want any more children with him, I was making plans to get away.

"But he went crazy when he found out I was taking contraception because he wanted to me to have loads of kids so he could control me.

“I had to take it – I had no choice.”

Just over a year later, in June 2012, she gave birth to their second daughter.

Laura said: "I had a check-up with my midwife, and she said my labour was starting and to pack my bag and get to the hospital.

(Image: FOCUS FEATURES)

“I cleaned the house, got my sister to look after my daughter, and asked Jamie to take me to hospital.

“But he refused, because we had no food in. He made me do a big shop at Iceland and by the time I had finished – and put the shopping away – I was in agony.

“He was sorting out his golf clubs, like there was no problem.

“I got to hospital and I was already 7cms dilated. Jamie started shouting: ‘It doesn’t take anyone else this long to give birth’ and he stormed off the labour ward.

“Twenty minutes later, our daughter was born.”

McKinlay was handed a two-year suspended sentence for assault but Laura took him back for a second time, admitting she was "infatuated with him".

(Image: FOCUS FEATURES)

She added: "I had got to the stage where I felt I couldn’t cope without him. He made me feel that I needed him."

In May 2014 McKinlay served 20 weeks on remand for assault and Laura had a third child, a boy, the following year.

But the turning point came at the end of 2015 when Laura was brave enough to finally walk away for good.

McKinlay was later sentenced to two years in jail for breach of a restraining order.

The judge said that he was ‘utterly controlling’ and that Laura was ‘immensely vulnerable.’

He added: “He had her over a barrel and could do whatever he wanted.”

Preston Crown Court heard McKinlay had a 46 offences on his record, including a number for violence and harassment.

Laura said: “That was the end for me. I found the strength to stand up to him, for my sake and for my children.”

She has since met a new partner and they have a son, two, and baby daughter together.
description: Laura Wallis also had to have sex with Jamie McKinlay at least once a day and was even screamed at for "taking too long to give birth"
